it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.ammo

Class AmmoTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.gamecomponents.ammo.AmmoTile

  • public class AmmoTile
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represent the base of every ammo tiles, with two ammo cube and, depending on the draw, a powerUp or a third ammo cube
    Author:
    Federico Innocente

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AmmoTile(AmmoCube firstAmmo, AmmoCube secondAmmo, AmmoCube thirdAmmo, boolean isPowerUpTile)
      Constructor: set the AmmoCubes array and, depending on isPowerUpValue, the third resource (PowerUp or AmmoTile)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AmmoCube[] getAmmoCubes()
      Getter method
      boolean isPowerUpTile()
      Getter method
      void pickAmmo(Player player)
      if a player hasn't pass the limit on 3 ammo cube for each color, grab all the possible AmmoCubes, if is a PowerUpTile he'll grab from a vector containing 2 elements and the powerUp
      void setPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
      Called when the tile is placed on board, set it's PowerUp

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AmmoTile

        public AmmoTile(AmmoCube firstAmmo,
                AmmoCube secondAmmo,
                AmmoCube thirdAmmo,
                boolean isPowerUpTile)
        Constructor: set the AmmoCubes array and, depending on isPowerUpValue, the third resource (PowerUp or AmmoTile)
        Parameters:
        firstAmmo - is the first AmmoCube
        secondAmmo - is the second AmmoCube
        thirdAmmo - is the third AmmoCube, null if isPowerUpTile
        isPowerUpTile - is true if the third resource is a PowerUp

    • Method Detail

      • setPowerUp

        public void setPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
        Called when the tile is placed on board, set it's PowerUp
        Parameters:
        powerUp - is the powerUp associated with the tile

      • getAmmoCubes

        public AmmoCube[] getAmmoCubes()
        Getter method
        Returns:
        the AmmoCube[] vector

      • isPowerUpTile

        public boolean isPowerUpTile()
        Getter method
        Returns:
        true if is a PowerUpTile (so AmmoCube'll be a 2 elements Vector)

      • pickAmmo

        public void pickAmmo(Player player)
        if a player hasn't pass the limit on 3 ammo cube for each color, grab all the possible AmmoCubes, if is a PowerUpTile he'll grab from a vector containing 2 elements and the powerUp
        Parameters:
        player - is the player that grab the AmmoTiles
